body:
Per IRC discussion today at http://www.erisian.com.au/bitcoin-core-dev/log-2021-01-07.html#l-87 with respect to -netinfo:

- raise if an invalid integer argument is passed
- enable `-netinfo help` to run without a remote server
- warn in `-netinfo help` that -netinfo is not intended to be a stable API

Proposing these fixes separately from the features in #20764 to simplify review, as the second commit here involves moving some code around. This one should probably go in first. 

-----

How to test manually:

- check out and build this branch locally; if you need help, don't hesitate to refer to https://jonatack.github.io/articles/how-to-review-pull-requests-in-bitcoin-core#pull-down-the-code-locally or https://jonatack.github.io/articles/how-to-compile-bitcoin-core-and-run-the-tests
- while it is compiling, look at the code changes
- stop signet (if it is running) with `./src/bitcoin-cli -signet stop`
- once the build is completed, run `./src/bitcoin-cli -signet -netinfo help`
- the help should be printed even though the signet server is not running
- near the top you should see the new warning, "This human-readable interface will change regularly and is not intended to be a stable API."
- start signet with `./src/bitcoind -signet`
- test that an invalid integer argument raises if you run `./src/bitcoin-cli -signet -netinfo 5` or `./src/bitcoin-cli -signet -netinfo a` (valid values are from 0 to 4)
- test that -netinfo works correctly with `./src/bitcoin-cli -signet -netinfo 4` etc.
- leave review feedback or `ACK <commit hash>` -- done :beers:
title: netinfo: user help and argument parsing improvements
